weeks.label: Week 1: How web works?
weeks.summary: Understand HTTP, the browser, the Client-Server model, create your first HTML, The head & body HTML, tables.

days.label: Monday
days.description: Start Coding right away! Explan the internet architecture in 5 minutes, then explain how the browser works and how HTTP works with one example. Then start coding right away, do the postcard and explain the tags as you use then in the project. Students should code the project with your lead.
days.homework: The students must finish the Postcard on their own (there is a video-tutorial)

days.label: Tuesday
days.description: Conecting CSS & HTML: Finish the postcard and start the Instagram. Review all the key concepts with your students.
days.homework: Students must finish the Instagram & the Postcard.

days.label: Wednesday
days.description: Explain the box model (display vs position) and manually create a 'rows & cols' layout simulating the bootstrap grid (but without bootstrap). Use that layout and apply it to the Instagram.

project.title: Finish the instagram with your students

days.homework: Students must finish the Instagram & the Postcard.

days.label: Thursday
days.description: Explain bootstrap and how it solves 99% of the pain. Everything is a component from now own.
Explicar bootstrap, como copiar y pegar los componentes para armar tu website y luego customizarlos a tu gusto.
key-concepts: Workflow: Copy&Paste your components and then customize them

days.label: Weekend
days.description: Students must finish all pending proyects!

weeks.label: Week 2: UI/UX, CMD & GIT
weeks.summary: Create a real website using a profesisonal workflow: From the wireframe to git.

days.label: Monday
days.description: Make the students design a website starting from the wireframe, teach them the importance of components and how to pick them and draw a wireframe jumping into coding.

project.title: Based on a fake client briefing, the students should build a sitemap and make a list of each page sub-section and the bootstrap components they will use on each section. Then draw the wirframe.

days.label: Tuesday
days.description: Teach the command line to your students, use the CMD challenge to make it very fun! Start with a small explanation about the importance of the CMD and then explain each command after its respective challenge is completed.
days.homework: At the end of the class, present the students with the GIT project & please ask each student to start coding its corresponding part of the website.

days.label: Wednesday
days.description: Time to explain and practice with GIT in detail, create a repository for your Landing Page GIT proyect and make them clone it and upload their piece of the proyect. Review the key concepts.
days.homework: At the end of the class, present the students with the GIT project & please ask each student to start coding its corresponding part of the website.

days.label: Thursday
days.description: The excuse generator is a great way to explain how Javascript and HTML/CSS can play togather. Do it with the students as you explain all the programing Key Concepts
days.homework: Students need to make the replits about javascript and the layout for the Random Card Generator

days.label: Weekend
days.description: Los alumnos deben terminar los replits de JS, Arrays y funciones

days.label: Monday
days.description: Como es el flujo de una aplicacion (window.onload), application runtime, etc.
days.project: Haz el random card generator con ellos, recuerda explicar bien (preload, onload)

days.label: Tuesday
days.description: Cambiar estilos dinamicamente con Javascript y generando codigo HTML dinamicamente. Realiza el Excuse Generator con los alumnos y enviales como tarea el Random Card Generator
days.homework: Que hagan los Replits de HTML, CSS, Bootstrap y Layouts

days.label: Wednesday
days.description: Explica claramente GIT claramente y realiza el landing page con los alumnos de forma colaborativa (cada alumno hace un pedacito del landing).

days.label: Thursday
days.description: Termina el landing con GIT, luego introduce programacion, demuestra como usas codigo par generar HTML dinamicamente: Loops, If...else, etc.
days.project: Empieza a hacer los ejercicios de replit con los alumnos
days.homework: Deja que hagan los replits para el fin de semana: Introduccion a JS, Arrays y Funciones

days.label: Weekend
days.description: Los alumnos deben terminar los replits de JS, Arrays y funciones
